comment: He was great and I learned a lot in his class.  I would love to take another class with him.  He was very caring and encouraging and made me want to be a great teacher.

Dr Ross is very unorganized.  He has tons of material online that is from prior semesters so it is unclear what the deadlines are.  He is constantly apologizing for incorrect or late material.  Otherwise, he is very lenient on deadlines.

Dr. Ross is so amazing. I took his online educ 2120 and then I studied abroad with him for educ 2130 in London. He is such an amazing teacher, and he wants you to do well. He is very helpful. It is an easy A!

I'll be honest, this class was easy. Dr. Ross though is the most arrogant and rudest professor I have ever met. I would have rather taken a challenging class and had a respectful professor. However, EDUC2120 was only offered online-so I didn't have a choice. Avoid him if possible-if not-it's an Easy A.  Group projects were so-so.

Online class: Ross gives you a second chance to get things right! I hate group projects but got through them-some nearly all on my own! You'll get an A if you do the work and make sure you get going on your group projects as soon as you can! Ross is a great professor! He's understanding, flexible, and fair, his projects get you thinking!

Online. 3 team projects, 2 individual projects, online quizzes, 15 hrs. observation through KSU Volunteer office. He is extremely picky with what he expects, even though the course was still being developed during the semester!

Dr. Ross is as hot as sunshine!  I came late to his class after camping with a friend and he was very understanding (called ahead of time). I hate to see the school go in the online direction bc he makes his class so enjoyable!  Certainly an edutainer!  ;)
He is fun and very personable. Extremely reasonable about the workload and will work with you in any way needed. Definitely the best professor in the Education dept.

Take this professor, if at all possible!  Class is fun and exciting.  Dr. Ross is hilarious and has years of expierence that he puts to good use.  One of the best classes I've taken at Kennesaw. Attendance is mandatory, but he gives you plenty of "sick days".  No test.  Didnt use the book. Projects are easy.  You'll learn a lot.
